intro: Mercurialis annua var. laciniata, commonly known as the cut-leaf mercury plant, is a variant of the common mercury plant. It is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is native to Europe and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas. The species is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
